Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First, I need to figure out which cases have longer lead times. The user wants to know which cases are taking significantly longer. To do that, I should calculate the total duration for each case from Submit Claim to Close Claim.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the table, each case has multiple entries. Let me list each case and compute their durations. Starting with Case 2001: Submit at 09:00 on April 1st Close at 10:30 on the same day. So the duration is about 1 hour and 30 minutes. That seems quick. Case 2002: Submitted at 09:05 on April 1st Closed at 11:00 on April 2nd. total 25h55m 25.9 hours. Case 2003: Submitted at 09:10 on April 1st Closed at 09:30 on April 3rd. total 48h20m 48.3 hours. That's way longer than the others. Case 2004: Submitted at 09:20 on April 1st Closed at 10:45 same day. That's about 1 hour 25 minutes. Very fast, similar to case 2001. Case 2005: Submitted at 09:25 on April 1st Closed at 14:30 on April 4th. total is 72 + 5h5m = 77 hours and 5 minutes. Approximately 77.08 hours. That's the longest.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So the cases with significantly longer durations would be 2003 and 2005. Cases 2002 is also longer than 2001 and 2004 but maybe not as extreme as 2003 and 2005. So cases with longer durations are 2002, 2003, 2005. But the user says significantly longer. Comparing the durations, 2005 is way longer than the others. Maybe cases 2003 and 2005 are the worst So 2003 and 2005 are significantly longer.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Now, the next step is to analyze the attributes. Let's look at each case's attributes. Case 2003: High complexity, Region A. It took ~48 hours. Case 2005: High complexity, Region B. Took ~77 hours. So high complexity seems to be a factor.

Text: But maybe also the number of document requests. Let's count how many times they had to request docs. Each Request might require customer response, causing delays. So the high number of Requests especially for high complexity cases might be a cause.

Alternatively, maybe the Region's processing time affects, but comparing case 2003 A and 2005 B: 2003 Region A, High: 48h vs 2005 Region B, High: 77h. So region B's high complexity case is worse.
